p9O-29X5cd4mCBsfbWhGWQ.text: I hate to write this.  I think Hob Nobs is a quirky little place with good food.  And I like supporting local businesses. Every Saturday I stop in for a large coffee to go.  And occasionally I enjoy their omelet bar which is fantastic.  Today, I ordered my coffee and was told the price was $4 and change.  This is more than I've ever paid so I asked if the price had gone up.  The counter person told me it was .75 for the cream in my coffee.  What? She was very nice. And very apologetic.  The person in line behind me said that he never tips at Hob Nobs with his credit card because the servers don't see the money.  I don't know if this is True, but  I can believe that any place that charges .75 for cream In Your coffee would do that too.   I'm very disappointed and won't be back.

yTkXqTrcMwcraD6WbITgNA.text: Good, solid food and super friendly service! The owners are wonderful and treat their regulars like family. I'm a big fan of their pizzas and baked goods, and the menu is extensive enough that you're bound to find something for everyone. They are happy to make things vegetarian on the menu, and I love that you can get an Italian soda with almond milk! Patio is large and dog friendly, another plus.

qeYgflmW5toCtqY6rXUunQ.text: I think the food is okay, their menu seems a tad overpriced. There's this one guy who plays live music on his guitar and its really nice. The service seems hit or miss depending on who is working. My husband and I had a little bit of an off-putting experience with the kid with the mustache, he was very rude to my husband for no reason at all. He seems like he might be just out of high school, but even then, needs to work on common courtesy and basic customer service skills. We decided it wasn't really worth returning after that.

lWsZOHsyM9prBnap1M78AA.text: We do office lunch takeout here and it makes everyone happy. The salads and sandwiches are a step above your standard sub shop. It's worth the price and the people are super nice. Pizza is a great value at 9 to 10 bucks. Get some.

ncBm2V5ioOxPP8Rfxzqq6Q.text: I tried really hard to like this cafe. My husband and I tried this place for a quick lunch. If only it was quick. When we came in the gentleman behind the counter let us know that it was counter service and then have a seat. No problem. We ordered and proceeded to sit outside. The seating was a bit odd and mismatched, somewhat uncomfortable. The noise from McDowell made it hard to have a conversation. After about 30 minutes, a man came out and asked if we had ordered the tamponade. We said no. He said, "well you can have this, it must have been extra." We let him know, by description, the two sandwiches we were waiting for. 10 minutes later a woman came out and put them in front of us without apology or letting us know what she was leaving.   The food was okay, but not good enough to overlook poor service and a 40 minute wait.   I went to the restaurant website and sent an email in hopes that it was a "one off" day and would have appreciated some feedback. None came. As I said, I really wanted to like a local neighborhood cafe but can not recommend at this time. The search continues.

qMiDgYC3DIlcM3JvDnC06w.text: We love Hob Nobs! Great people! Great vibe! Fabulous food! Best brunch at super reasonable price. Cheers!

BlhmJeJQdo26z1fH0ylpRw.text: I have been here numerous times and watched throughout the years this place grow, although I don't remember the food all that much, I had a cup of cappuccino tonight and it had a lot to be desired. Cup was waaaay too big (monstrous, really), and there were normal cappuccino  cups right there, had to send it back to have them reheat it and I think the Italians are turning over in their grave by people calling their cappacino, cappuccino. The girl definitely needs to be taught how to make a cappuccino.

mjKWD-v76efyY6kPCO28ug.text: What a cute place!!! We decided to have breakfast with the pups at the last minute and luckily found this adorable restaurant with a dog friendly patio. We were the only customers there (not surprising since it was about 7 am on a Saturday) but saw that they were preparing for their omelette bar. Wish we would've gone later to try that but maybe next time.  The staff was super friendly and the gentleman at the counter made you feel right at home. I ordered the breakfast sandwich and added avocado and their garlic aioli. So glad I did! Their garlic aioli was delicious and added so much flavor to the sandwich!! I would definitely recommend trying it. Their pizzas looked delicious also but at 7 am, I was not ready for pizza. I plan on going back and enjoying their live music and pizza at a later time in the day :).

photos.caption: Photo of Hob Nobs - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cJs9F7BObFHwyxld6503Hw.text: This place is the best!!  The staff is so friendly and helpful! Favorite breakfast spot!

vX6ooWIvOdJSEM5M0d6rsw.text: Hob Nobs is in a cozy bungalow with a fireplace, very relaxed atmosphere. Lovely outdoor patio, sometime has live jazz, which is quite nice. Friendly staff. A vast menu.... Soups, salads, sandwiches, pizza, appetizers, smoothies, baked goods, teas, bottled sodas, beer and wine. It's well kept up, clean and food is always fresh. Each time I've gone, no complaints/ food is always delicious. To me, if you blended your home with a cafe, a bakery, diner and pub, you'd have Hob Nobs. The only minus I can think of is their parking situation. It's very limited but there are places to park across the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Hob Nobs - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum... Sausage pizza, caprese skewers &amp; vino!

fufh0k_ZKAcVU-Ur5blw3w.text: I had the Doc's Choice Sandwich, which was an excellent choice with a side salad plus a ice tea. The staff was great.

eKTmxciXO610IERv4WT6NA.text: 10/10 will patronize here again.   I want to start this review off by saying I shattered my phone, and through broken glass, I'm writing this review because I want the world to know how much I like this spot!!   It reminds me of a cute cottage turned into a cafe/bar. We showed up at 9:04....which was 4 minutes after their kitchen closed but the lovely woman behind the bar made sure to stop the kitchen staff so we could eat. I am eternally grateful.   I ordered the shrimp po' boy. It had more than enough shrimp with a delicious sauce with a bit of a kick. It came with a slice of watermelon!! I loved that. They have beer on tap and several wines to choose from as well.   If you've read any of my reviews, you know the most important thing to me is dog friendly... so yes they get this star! They have a patio for dogs and brought out water for my dog. On my way out, they gave us some yummy treats to make sure my dog was fat and happy.  You know they say dogs are just like their owners.

AcD92C0gYkboUgREbScpeQ.text: What a cute place! My husband and I will definitely be back. The food was delicious and the people are super friendly. There is also seating inside and outside.  My husband ordered The Carver which is a roasted sirloin sandwich, which was accompanied with kettle chips. He gave me a bite and it was delicious! The white cheddar cheese, thinly sliced sirloin and that roasted garlic aioli on top of their focaccia bread was soooo good. The mix of Dijon mustard and garlic aioli gave this sandwich a nice kick.  I ordered the Voodoo Chicken Salad, which was made by the lady who greeted me. Very good as well and provided a slight spice. The salad is served with their Roquefort dressing so if you aren't into this, they also have ranch. To be honest though, I didn't need but only a little dressing.  Definitely, give this place a try. While I didn't drink, they do have a bar. They also serve breakfast, which I'm sure is yummy too.

zINzTuQ0GlnflLzAvZfMag.text: Good food and a cute space. Big patio with live music on Fridays. Tried the bruscetta, jalapeno poppers, and pizza. We'll be going back.

NEO-CFGH516tkf6EjXF3uw.text: Here's what I want. I want a coffee shop where I can do my work in a peaceful and cozy setting without sitting on top of the person next to me and I'd love to have the option of a good sandwich if I happen to stay during lunch hour. I think I found that at Hob Nobs.    After driving by Hob Nobs too many times over the years, I finally made my way inside through the adorable patio surrounding a quaint historic house. The moment I stepped inside, it felt like I had stepped into a welcoming home. The warm wooden floors complimented the historic banisters and the house had the old feeling to it without smelling old. That's a plus and sometimes hard to find in an old house.   I looked around and saw plenty of seating options including several tables and chairs on the patio and several all throughout the house, including a converted sun room in the front. But personally, my favorite area was the living room with a worn in leather couch and two leather chairs looking at the fireplace still decorated with Christmas attire.   The staff warmly greeted me and I asked the lady what she normally likes. She pointed me in the direction of the Smokey Joe -- Gouda, turkey and tomato on white bread. I opted out of the Dijon and added in honey mustard and it was definitely a tasty treat! The bread was toasted and the turkey was warm and freshly roasted. The honey mustard with sweet and creamy all in one. It came with a pickle and small cup of fruit. The meal itself wasn't on the cheap end ... more like middle of the road expensive...about $10 for a sandwich and drink. However, I think it's definitely worth it if you are looking for a place to set up shop for awhile and this is definitely a cozy spot. Awhile later, I needed a caffeine boost to get me through part two of the day, so I went the iced coffee route. They have a huge assortment of syrups and the coffee is freshly roasted and tasty. It was just $2 for a 16 oz cup of coffee which isn't bad in my book! So, while the sandwiches might be a bit on the pricier end, the coffee is spot on reasonably priced. Plus on the sandwich end, the ingredients are so fresh, I'd rather pay a bit more for the oven turkey like I had.   So whether it's warm or cool weather, Hob Nobs is an excellent option for a True coffee house experience...they even have life music some nights!

photos.caption: Photo of Hob Nobs - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great scenery while I eat a sandwich and do some work!

lQ_TK2zC8ymFgfEicy39zQ.text: We do the groupon now deals to find new restaurants.  We went to Hob Nobs Cafe & Spirits on Saturday afternoon.  The place had a great atmosphere, very eclectic styling...very downtown feel.  Loved it.  We came in from Cave Creek and enjoyed the cool vibe.  Staff were very friendly.  All of the sandwiches can be changed to Wraps. The food was excellent.  I can't believe the JJ J. or Mya T's reviews!  Can't wait to go back to try the pizza, looked and smelled terrific.  Thanks.

Y19jrWRA66tU-xx9SJxKSA.text: Good food, great atmosphere, wonderful employees and live music. Offers more than your run of the mill coffee shop. Not to mention a fantastic beer selection!

2vQYk8s8J8EC44tTimjAag.text: Well, sadly the coffee is lackluster.   BUT the pastries! the pastries! I oogled the muffins. They were so unique. I had a mandarin orange vanilla honey one. The texture is more like angel food cake, but it tasted goooooood and that's all you need to sell me on. There was an m&m flavor too, I just pictured one of my kids from the au pair gig being head over heels gaga on that whole deal.   Side note, is it just me or does the building look like it's straight from the shire??

7uas7mywLd3ojCJS4VD1GA.text: I really like this neighborhood coffee shop!  The people are pretty chill and the space is pretty cool as well.  I have been there for lunch and their lunch options are quite good!  The desserts are amazing as well, the oatmeal cookies were to die for!  Great Job Hob Nobs!

WFi9OOsfzFERzVb-igaLzw.text: We live in the neighborhood. Went there a few times to get tea. I decided to get a h

DG1lpISAxVswkSjfrSCa8Q.text: I had lunch here and coffee, of course, which is what I consider the baseline for all um... coffee joints. It was a mixed bag. I hadn't been here since the place was Willow House and was mostly decorated with dirty hippies. I approve of the change. Let's sample the wares, shall we?  OK so first of all, the coffee is weak. Tastes like mom's coffee. Maybe that's your thing, it's not mine. Second, when I am asked if I want "room for cream," and I say "yes," I am not giving you the green light to put in what you figure is an appropriate amount of cream. Seriously did this just happen? Yep, it sure did. Oh, and it was too much freaking cream - shocking, right? Why would anyone do this? People's idea of what the right amount of cream is simply *has* to vary too much for anyone to think this is a good idea. So yeah. Boo.  It's too bad the place bills itself as a "coffee house," because the sandwich I had ("Vito's" - the Italian one) made up for the coffee disaster. WOW. This was a GREAT sandwich. The bread tasted like it came from the Willo bakery down the street if the Willo bakery had ever made bread that was anything approaching edible, which it never has so I don't know why I even said that. The bread was a ciabatta type bread, lush, moist and delicious. The sandwich was overstuffed to the breaking point with meats and cheeses and had a delicious Italian dressing to top it off. The kalamata olives were a nice touch. Voted A+++ - would eat sandwich again!  All in all, I'd gladly go back. For the food. The coffee? Not so much. Maybe if you're the "half caf double decaf caf with whipped cream and a shot of Bolivian Espresso" type the place is like indie Starbucks heaven, I don't know. I'm the coffee type. With a bit of cream, which I am given to understand is actually weirder these days than the half caffers. WHATEVER

shFSML85ZL24oh5vp23KGQ.text: They burned the espresso beans in my cappuccino. It's a coffee shop right? They should make good coffee and espresso drinks. If you can't do a cappuccino right you have no business being in the coffee business. In addition, it took forever to get my bagel and cream cheese(over 15min). A wednesday at 10am is hardly an overly busy time. Am I wrong to expect prompt efficient and quality service from a coffee house. I had three sips of the cappuccino and pitched it. The bagel was fine, but its not as though they are baking them in the back. Save your money and go to lux or even starbucks for that matter.

mzaYDq2BR0-j07MDRjuScw.text: I wish I could pick this coffee house up and drop it in my neighborhood. We discovered Hob Nob on a First Friday (we saw it on the ArtLink map of local businesses). There was live music playing, and the staff was super friendly-and helped us pick out some really yummy lemon cake and nut free brownie.  So delicious and my white chocolate mocha was great. The ambiance is unlike anything I've seen in AZ-it had a real, authentic, coffee house setting ( I hate comparing everything to back East, but it's all I got to compare it to people)..but it does feel like a super cool, Montclair NJ sort of joint. (shout out to NJ). Anyway..tons of local art on display and I was amazed at all the seating (inside and out). Loved it! My local place, True Brew is my fave, but this is a perfect spot for a late night treat on a weekend.

z76DM9jo__-B_31Dds_ZqA.text: Okay, I've never seen this place before and I was only in the area to attend a planning meeting for the 2011 Phoenix Film Festival, and just stumbled across it. It looked like one of those cool renovated houses and I saw that this weekend they were grilling locally made dogs, of various types on the patio. Being someone who can never pass up trying a new hot dog place, I stopped in.  Well let me tell you...wow....what a beautiful place. It is all dark hardwood inside with tables throughout various rooms, and these beautiful stained glass windows in the back. It reminds me of some places I visited in Denver, Colorado but I never expected to find a place like it in Phoenix. I did notice that they sell a number of various sandwiches and some wickedly awesome looking pastries (trying to avoid sugar so I could only look, not taste), but I was there for the dogs...and I was not to be deterred in my mission. I found out that they had several different types of sausages with one being a chicken tequila and lime sausage which, being overweight and middle aged, I thought was the safest choice for my cardiovascular system. I got an iced tea along with it and then they gave me a basket with a bun in it and told me to take it outside to the grill.  There are three or four patio tables outside with some shade (it was rather sunny today...as is most days in Phoenix) and they were still setting up and prepping the hot water baths for the various dogs. As part of the process they have a flat grill that goes on top of the regular one and they were grilling up a whole mess of green peppers and onions. I had the good fortune to meet one of the owners of the establishment and learned this place used to be the Willow house before they took it over (never been there but I understand people liked it quite a bit).   Well, to get to the food, the chicken sausage, I found out, is made by the family that owns it, special family recipe and it was sooooo good. I had it with brown mustard and sauerkraut and the owner even grilled the bun, it was wonderful. It would be nice to maybe have a side of chips as well but otherwise perfect.  So, the grilled dogs are wonderful but I think this will be a great spot for my Sunday morning ritual of coffee drinking and reading the Sunday NYT. I found they open at 7 am on the weekends so I'll be there bright and early to grab my spot and enjoy the sort of coffee house atmosphere that is not all that easy to find here in Phoenix...hope to see you there! :-)

jH-do9LSTVq2a6bm6OVAIw.text: It has good seating, large tables, live music (Fri/Sat nights, Sun afternoons), free wi-fi and the fundamentals of everything else. I cannot honestly complain.  I haven't tried much of their food but tonight we had a white pizza and it was absolutely DELISH. Seriously.  Oh... and they DELIVER! Nothing like have a pizza and latte delivered... with minimum purchase there is no fee for delivery. Knocks the heck out of Pizza Hut/Dominos...  Staff is super-friendly and the music is hit or miss but if you can, give it a go. Short walk from Central/McDowell light rail.  But, no cupcakes. How sad is that?

abhtSTdNBJ_BcD_YvndhGQ.text: Excellent sandwich and salad.  Nice little cafe on the corner, great service.  Will defiantly be going back to try the other sandwich's and the breakfast menu.

FV0SwDiqlFZF4T233FvsjA.text: Welp... Sent some friends here.. They don't check I.Ds if you order an alcoholic beverage.. They don't use gloves to make the food.. They spent more time playing around in the back of the kitchen .. It took 35 minutes for my buddies to get their food.. It needs new management ... This is ridiculous ... No personality .. No fun.. Boring corny live music.. Come one now guys.. You can do better..

3lsDwycd8cvqsAnIxNAB7A.text: Not sure what to give this place. Went in for breakfast with two friends this Saturday. Menu for breakfast is very limited to steel cut oatmeal, quiche and a breakfaast sandwhich. We each had the breakfast sandwhich on different breads with different cheese, meat and toppings.  I asked for my bread to be buttered but it was not so I got cold butter from the kitchen to spread on my basically cold sandwhich that had just arrived. They also season the eggs without telling you with some herbs that turned out to taste ok but looked questionable. Two of us had ice tea, which was very weak and one had coffee but I no idea what he thought of it since he didn't have any more.  One of the cooks brought out a fresh baked blueberry scone as an apology for sending out a less than perfect breakfast.  Hmmm makes me wonder if he knew our food was damn near cold?   The scone was large and delicious. Actually all the bake goods looked very good on display.   The place is very charming and it even has outside seating which is nice.  But the bill was $26 for cold breads with cold eggs and a small meat portion that if you didn't look for it one would miss.  So I give the place 2 stars. Earned by a good scone, a cute building and a kind gester of the staff.  But I wasn't impressed enough to return.  Oh yeah I found a hair on my egg but I'm hoping it was my own. But as I think about it now It probably was not mine as I read others review. Ewwwww  Also the lunch menu does not appeal to me.  And many would agree that the presentation is lacking and the price is on the high side. And while serving beer upsets another yelper because she will not study there because of it now. I don't think it has hurt the business and I'm sure their limited seating does not encourage people to dwell for hours anyhow. Oh and parking is very limited also another reason one might not linger for hours.

P0MCN_7KHHD4SrnPEgIRuA.text: Very cozy, love the various rooms ad seating opportunities. Must be a great place to hang in the warmer weather on the patio.   Lost a star for two reasons: 1)they pour the cream for you. I didn't realize this and would have specified skim milk ahead of time, but instead watched a big glug of half-and-half go into my husband's coffee. They were very accommodating and made me a new one, but I would still like to be able to doctor my coffee myself.   2)The music is a radio station, complete with annoying, repetitive GreatClips ads (Men's haircuts just $7.99!!!). Come on, just plug in an iPod and play some constant music. No one wants to listen to radio ads while chilling at the coffee house.   Coffee was fine. The food looked good; people have complained about the prices, but why are you going to a coffee place for food? It was maybe a dollar on the pricey side, I guess.   I have no problem with the presence of beer, but what with the beer and the gigantic PIZZA banner out front, it makes me wonder if Hob Nobs is struggling with identity. Pick one and go with it, please.   Overall a pleasant experience; just a few glitches.

dV2mDYmVji8dLmNkPa1x8A.text: Went in to grab a coffee and a delicious pastry and was surprised to find live jazz on a Saturday night. They need to change their hours here on yelp and on their website-they close at 9pm on Saturdays!

b56kR4--yZpE6CB4h54Efw.text: Some of the best pizza I have had in a long time. Try the Red Sauce, Chipotle, Spinach,Bacon, Pepperoncini,Tomatoes & Mozzarella Pizza.

NqGTIsafJyyYJCqiIJR0kQ.text: I love Hob Nobs! I've been downtown for about a year now and go there often, there sandwiches and salads are delicious...  I love vito's favorite, mmmm! They have life music, art from local artists for sale... Everyone there is always very friendly, free wi-fi, a nice cozy setting. Camel macchiatos are yummy as hell, go get one! I'm pretty sure they even have pizza! (Not that I would recommend combining the two!)

uUNkQ5hBMR2lizacnbNYVw.text: Fantastic place. Amazing service, and they serve DOGFISHHEAD 120 MINUTE IPA! (when available). This place is the best of the best for coffee shop/beer selection. Tiny little historic home, very dear to my heart. I didn't think anything could replace the Willow House, but as I grew up, so did  my coffee tastes.

hoVfzbTHTUNpN4Bw_v_8IQ.text: This small cafe bar hybrid is trying too hard. Staff is mildly inept, reminiscent of a drugged out college campus coffee shop, and the patrons range from crunchy granola wannabe to self righteous thespian. The food is fine, nothing spectacular but worth the price. The beer selection is wonderful, especially for a cafe in phoenix, but the staff doesn't seem to know the difference between a beer other than color. the cashier proceeded to tell my wife, a veteran, that someone always asks vets how many people they killed, though advised to be careful so they don't freak out and blow the place up. Quaint. Offensive. Not even environmentally friendly. Also, we almost got attacked by a dog on our way in. The only reason I'd come back would be to chuckle at actresses boasting about performances and geeky kids insisting complete strangers look EXACTLY like a younger, wiser Jerry Garcia. If your a lost, self conscious liberal unsure of safe places in a big republican state, look no further. Otherwise, don't waste your time, head down the street to Sun Up brewery.

vlFf0H7l8YSDDYziEdHkZg.text: I am part of a group that meets once a week in the evenings.  The staff was very welcoming to us, and even stays open an hour later for us so that our fairly large group has access to food, drinks, and restrooms.  As far as customer service goes, it just doesn't get better than that.   It also helps that the staff is welcoming, friendly, cheerful, and fun to interact with.   As for the food, I've never tried anything there I didn't like, and I never hear complaints from anyone in my group about what they order.  In fact, usually, everyone's food looks so good that people who weren't planning on eating anything end up ordering something they saw someone else munching on and it just looked too yummy to resist.   I've had: the caprese salad, the shrimp & white sauce pizza, the pepperoni pizza, their sugar-free pumpkin cupcakes, their brownies (heated up with whipped cream and drizzled with caramel sauce-to die for), various cookies and pastries, their coffee... all of it is stellar.  They also, amazingly enough, have a PHENOMENAL selection of beers.  All kinds, and they even have a $1.95 bottled beer of the day special every day.  Usually this prompts me to try something I've never had before, and being a beer fan, this just tickles me pink.  The times I've been there, all but once their daily selection was something new to me, and not a typical beer.  Of course, one time, their beer of the day was Bud Lite, which I passed on.    They also have harder liquors, and several specialty beers on tap, not to mention wines by the bottle or glass.   Prices are very reasonable, especially for the quality of the food you're getting.  I can't say enough good things about this place.

zC5GABnh4rj3cBHoOEXq1w.text: This a great place for lunch or a specialty drink.  I really enjoy the pizzas, and the coconut cake is pretty much amazing.

mDvRVYaVeIt_9xbbw9mx9Q.text: I like this place as I tend to like local small business over corporate giants.  One word of advice is I think they are trying to do too much, Focus on a smaller menu and make sure what you serve is the best quality and freshest it can be.  This is always my problem with the big diners in NYC where they have every possible item on the menu but nothing is a standout.  Also layout is a little too open for my tastes. I like a little more nook'ish seating.

k9Rj2V_16qSuuK-e22y_NA.text: Food is plain , kitchen was dirty, took an hour for my food, the owner ignored us, the bathroom was dirty,  flies were everywhere because they didn't clean the tables. . When they did , I saw the kid use a dirty rag.. horrible ...

PRi3bIdzHqSv3D9nG4T5Jw.text: FREE performance by:  Darron Weston performs solo: country, blues, folk, other classic covers every Tuesday and Wednesdays 6 to 9.  I prefer the Tuesdays since there is another group that attends on Wednesdays.  I'm not passing judgement, but absolutely NOT my thing.

iqwY5_h22slTQ2gEPGRM3A.text: Doesn't even deserve 1 star. Music was too loud for the middle of the day. Our food was delivered to another table, then removed from their table & brought to us. Then they did not get the soup order correct - stating "I'll check on that". After over 5 mins passed I called to ask (there are no servers) if the correct soup would be sent & still took a while to get a disgusting over microwaved beef & vegetable. The pieces of meat were like hard rocks & frankly the soup tasted like it was tainted. The tomato & basil soup had a good flavor, however was cold upon serving. Definitely will not return. I figure this must be more of a drinking hole.

f-b20ufnrrLqBNkY-y_xaw.text: They have green tea, baked goods and good food, artwork to look at, live music and BEER. Even better, they have specials on said beer! It's also great for people watching and the staff has always been friendly whenever I've been there. It's a great place to go after work and unwind, which I do pretty often.

vLCj2kgaLConVSt40YRv5g.text: Good, not great coffee. They have some AMAZING food, that you wouldn't expect. They have the best veggie sandwich in town, incredible salads, and some wonderful baked goods.   When I wasn't vegan, I definitely loved the waffles. TRY them. Spoil yourself a little.

Mw3j6a56P5d91h9j5rRsnw.text: nice nice spot to have a coffee was coming. From.work.thought I stop in have coffee good choice.and cold.water right.there.to drink very cool ill be back soon

BwFI997OMJveLx3Rbef2Tg.text: I've been very impressed with this place both times I've been here. Yesterday at the recommendation of an employee I got the Doc's sandwich - I can't remember the exact name and it's not listed online, but she was so right.  It's mesquite smoked turkey, spicy aioli, peporoncini, onions, on this outstanding pretzel bread, toasted. Just the right amount of zing to it, though it had a bit more aioli than I would have cared for. It's slightly pricey at 8.95, though it comes with a (small) side of fruit. The first time there I got the Smokey Joe (mesquite smoked turkey breast, smoked gouda, lettuce, onion, tomato & cilantro with garlic aioli - w/o bacon for me) - also very good.  Next time I go I'll have to try the coffee, and they do have a surprisingly large selection of bottled beer.  I really like what the owners did with the old Willow House, which I used to go to back in the day. When I first went to Hob Nobs I was kind of sad to see the old place change, but they did such a great job with the renovation that it's hard to complain.   As others have noted, the parking is very tight; I've gotten lucky, but I'm pretty sure there's a sign that says you can park across the street.  (By the way, for some reason Yelp has separate listings for "Hob Nobs" and "Hob Nobs Coffee House. Not sure why.)

c-UzX7n7lL-5_nVgKSMaMQ.text: I'm kind of confused as to how I ended up spending $25 on 2 lattes, 1 wrap, and 1 brownie...  The price to satisfaction ratio on this place is not very good.  The lattes were okay, but I get much better value and flavor at Lola's down the block.  Their vegetarian wrap was covered in some kind of greasy dressing and loaded with olives (even though I requested no olives).  The brownie was HUGE, but very dry.   I'm also kind of confused as to why this place was PACKED on Sunday at 3pm.  Maybe there was some kind of meetup event?  Maybe people really do love this place?? It took forever to place my order because the barista/order-taker/cashier had too many tasks and there was only one of her.

6hdXCQrBqccLDkR8znoo4A.text: Review is just for drinks and service only.  Cute little old house-turned-coffee shop.   Art works everywhere including under the glass topped tables, which I kinda enjoyed looking at.   With the fireplace set right where the living room would have been, it gives a feeling of homey coziness.  There's also Wi-Fi service! We were a little too early for another puppet show, so I decided to drive around a little to look for a coffee shop.  With all the one way streets downtown, I didn't want to go too far and not find my way back!!! The three kids had cold chocolate milk....it felt like 100 degrees at 9:30am.  They downed that pretty well.  What the heck was I thinking?  All sugared up for an hour of Three Billy Goat Gruff? I ordered a vanilla chai latte.  Not bad.   I am still looking for strong spicy chai around the valley.   Definitely coming  back here to try the other stuff on their menu.

0biCC0y5zz_KuRuIBTQc5w.text: Coffee is great and the food is good but the owner leaves something to be desired. I've had two such situations where was asked to move tables so that others could sit there after I was done eating. I study and eat here a lot or should say used to after I was asked to leave my table so a S&M fetish group could have the area.

QPC6tkP8mnIFAybZEFuffw.text: The chicken ceaser pizza was the best that I've ever had. And for the brothers that love sammiches, have the "smokin joe" you will see why later. And the owners are some of the coolest people I've ever met can't wait to go back!

rQhN5KgSmtY3T1SvxppVow.text: Great little coffee shop downtown, delicious coffee, wonderful sandwiches, fresh salads and homemade soups, although they tend to run out especially of their incredible clam chowder. They also have tempting looking desserts, but I've never partaken. Lovely comfy cozy rooms with ample light, a main room with overstuffed chairs & sofa, others with wooden chairs, even a picnic style, & all with delightful artwork & handmade crafts - for sale. Nouveau riche boutique, pricey but nice. They also have umbrella shaded tables outside. Live acoustic music some evenings otherwise fairly quiet as rooms are sectioned off like a home with the glass counter where you place your order at the heart. The only downside is the parking is scarce. Very. As there have been too many times I really wanted to stop in, but could find nowhere near enough to park, I haven't been as much. In fact it's been a while but good enough an experience I wanted to share my more positive memories.

Uub74zbWIIieTLCIbsiugQ.text: Hob Nobs Coffee House is in this quaint little old house on McDowell not far from the downtown area.  Upon entering I wasn't clear as to if I was in a coffee house or a trendy gift shop with art for sale everywhere you looked.  I also did not experience the aroma of freshly brewed coffee as I walked in but I was greeted by a very friendly person behind their counter that offered to make me a cup of joe.  Their coffee was congenial and pleasant.  They had a limited amount of the normal coffee house accompaniments ~ a few pastries and cookies~ to coffee.  They seemed to be more of a cafe or dinner based on what they are offering their customers.  Pizza at a coffee house?  Now that's different...    They have a huge selection of pizzas, sandwiches and wraps.  Salads and a few breakfast and bunch options as well.    It was very difficult to get as comfy as I do in most coffee houses, but then again I'm not sure this is really a coffee house but more of a cafe "slash" gift shop.  Nothing against the owners and I don't blame them for trying to maximize their revenues through additional avenues other than coffee.  But you might consider changing your name to Hob Nobs Cafe and gift shop?  This is a cool place to meet people for lunch you don't know.    Hear me out ~ Their tables and chairs are not very comfy so it makes it easier for you to end your conversation.  This can be a good thing you know : -)

1QjxIsZU20Joc1j8IExZ_Q.text: It had been years since I stopped by this old house now the Hob Nobs Coffee House.  You walk in and the place has been redone with tons of local art everywhere.  There are a variety of soft drinks and juices on the refrigerators for those that don't drink coffee but we all know everyone drinks coffee!  They offer some craft beers with a respectable selection.  Oh yeah and they have wines but for some reason they are hidden away.    There are several great sandwiches I can recommend but the Vito's Favorite is definitely my pick (minus the mustard they don't mention on the menu).  Another one you will not really care about but if you like Oatmeal try their irish blend which is my favorite with some expresso.  Lastly, Parking is tight behind the building but Parking is available across the street.

5BotdlSGxdiuhpE-Aipu5A.text: This place is nice and upscale now, but totally lacks service and personality. I went in on a Wednesday, there were a few people for lunch. I ordered a sandwich, it was dry and I ended up leaving half in the trash. I used to love the old Willow house, the food was better and the chai tea was to die for. Will not be coming back to this place again.

cZcFz9k59P9KGe0PpoABIg.text: This place has absolutely no soul. It's that sterile museum-like type of place where you feel like you can't touch anything. Not the kind of environment for a coffee house in what used to be a pillar to the Phoenix Art and Music Scene. I don't care how dingy and mismanaged the former Willow House became. When it came down to it, it was still one of the best things Phoenix had to offer it's counter-cultural artsy citizens. The former Willow House may not have been as spruced up as a place Hob Nobs is today, but the food was better, the service was more genuine, and the events there were fantastic. Poets had their own night, Musicians had their own open mic that drew in some of the best local talent Phoenix has today, and so on...Now...it's all just a fading memory.   Simply put, Hob Nobs has inferior baristas, the art is disgustingly main-stream/mass-market looking, and the live music they have there is so bad, Starbucks wouldn't even play it. Their prices are too high for mediocre food, and don't even get me started on their baked goods. To the people who think the art is gorgeous... have you never walked into ANY of the dozens of REAL art galleries in Phoenix? Also, I'm no interior designer, but leather seats and high wooden pub tables in one room and chrome and glass w/ a flat-screen TV in another doesn't seem like the place I'd like to be in. One star for the bathroom upgrade, but I guess it doesn't matter since they shit all over the place anyway.  PS. I'm not just saying all of this as a blind Willow House loyalist-- if you look through my reviews, I frequent most of the coffee shops all around town and this one is just a huge rip-off.  OH, and they have permission to sell beer now...which is probably because their coffee sucks so bad, no reasonable sober person could possibly want any.

uBZ58fAEpLs1hHQ8IhyNyw.text: Love the location, breakfast sandwiches are excellent - lunch sandwiches are also pretty, and deserts are amazing.  Just based on the food, I would give it 5 stars.   Unfortunately the last few times we've been there, the service from the guy at the front has been terrible. He's not friendly, never smiles, and always acts as if we are troubling him, and has twice forgotten part of our order. The older woman is awesome so if you go there, do your best to avoid the guy - he has black hair and wears glasses. He's easily identified as he's the only one that doesn't smile in the whole place.

_5N2wcnXo0gH9t8FNf-I8Q.text: We always stop her after arriving in town and have breakfast or lunch . People are so friendly here and welcoming . Great sandwiches  and good pizza as well .Cant go wrong here , plenty of seating in or outside

iOyyr-OLCya-WgrglOeDFQ.text: I was looking for a spot to meet my sister at a halfway point for brunch, and this place did NOT disappoint! I don't know that I've been at a friendlier gathering place with attention on food and customer service. I will be back with more family members and or friends. The food was great, prices great for what you get - especially with bottomless mimosas at $9. We really enjoyed our experience. Simply charming!

jqB-IVE7z0-GCiuOuuDsTA.text: This place is so cute and welcoming. My husband and I stopped in today craving sandwiches and we left very satisfied. Will definitely be returning to try other things!

jIS7ZzlzqN7jS90ZSWm5fg.text: Visiting from Orange County with a group of 7 of us. We found this place and it's so cute! Bottomless mimosas with your meal, great pricing, great atmosphere. The servers were great and super friendly! Definitely coming back here whenever I'm in Phoenix.

O14G9GFGIXl7aHPwKVqXcg.text: The environment at this place a terrific! The service is spot on and very friendly.  I had the pepperoni pizza and it was good but but not great. My buddy got the sandwich of the day. I would be more interested in trying the sandwiches. 3 stars till next visit.

0wyY8tPaPNJYdPt8-gK2cg.text: I love this place. Just what a local restaurant should be. Everyone is always so friendly and helpful. I come here time and time again and I am always so pleased. Everything is just so good! They make many of their things in house and they're so fresh. I love the unique atmosphere and live entertainment. They're great for breakfast too.

I030F26TkwKw1IYaixJaIQ.text: First time here and this place is super cute!! Looks like a great place to come try for Happy Hour! If you love craft beers, they have a lot! The food was yummy! We will come again and try the wine next!

Order at the counter from a menu that can please carnivores and vegetarians.  Sandwiches are tasty and filling. Service staff is quite pleasant and efficient. Prices are $, very reasonable.

Po9nFZkL7Ill6kLH202H4A.text: Super cute, good selection of drinks, quality food (it would be nice if they had some vegan options, but with modifications you are good). The bartender was very fun to chat with and clearly loved his job. Sadly there was no live music when we went, but we still had a good time.

jXA0wOnEdDRu4R6Jz6KKpg.text: Great Phoenix treasure!  I've driven by Hob Nobs over the years and finally stopped in to check it out.  Great place, cool vibe, had no idea the diverse menu and even a full bar!  We stopped in quick to get some food to go, I ordered the Doc's Choice sandwich and my daughter had the Garlic Shrimp Pizza.  The service was friendly and attentive and the food was awesome!  My sandwich was incredibly tasty and my daughter's pizza was delicious.  We will be back!!!!

azHJmjU4sJiGmk5LZWl7sA.text: FANTASTIC  I had the most delicious chicken salad, the honey mustard dressing was to die for!!! My husband had the chicken tortilla soup, the best either of us has ever had !! My son had the docs choice sandwich on the pretzel roll, delicious!!  My other picky eater said there grilled cheese was two thumbs up !! Finished it all of with coconut cream cake, winner!!!  Such a friendly group of people!!! It was a perfect dining experience!!! Can't wait to go back

yC9g2Yf1gZR6LfdUDQ93WA.text: The food here is so good, this is my favorite place to eat. The pizzas are amazing, the people are great, the inside is really perfect. They are really accommodating to allergies and custom orders. Their black tea lemonade with mango is my favorite drink.  Parking is a pain but the food is totally worth it. I strongly recommend any pizza and any sandwich, you will not go wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of Hob Nobs - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Cesar pizza and Gluten Free pizza, both really delicious

xO9DK8nMyt9PEuDbePqPeA.text: Food was good (greek pizza voodoo chicken salad) and the interior was nice -- the rest of our visit was nowhere near what I expected based on other reviews. Maybe it was an off day or something but the tip of the iceberg was walking in on a chalboard that said, "Order a pear cider!" and, after ordering a pear cider, getting a somewhat surprised look and being informed that there was no pear cider. However, all appeared to be well when, after a quick check behind the bar, the staff member suggested a nice pineapple cider. Sure thing! I don't know why it was on the chalkboard then but, whatever, I thought.  But then what arrives at my table after we were seated but a warm pear cider in a pint glass. Seriously, it was flat and had obviously been poured from a bottle that couldn't have gone in the refrigerator five minutes ago. It was the impression that I couldn't shake the rest of our meal (a warm pineapple cider can only improve a salad and pizza so much), though both the pizza and salad were good.   I really expected more from this place. Maybe I need to give them a shot when it's cold and just go with some coffee. It had to be an anomaly that service was that so poor that day.

photos.caption: Photo of Hob Nobs - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dining area

pN9LtmmcmqtMucIRGKnjVw.text: Food was okay, had the breakfast sandwich along with a waffle, i coulda gone without the breakfast sandwich, but the waffle was good, they seemed to be out of alot of ingredients the day I went, no strawberries (however they charged me for them and then gave me a cookie instead) also no bananas for my waffles, the prices are steep for a place like this, breakfast was $25 before tip

l0MhgSuO5AVqeyRxSqa9Wg.text: This place is a diamond in the rough. You'd never think it; but it is the most amazing and friendly place in Phoenix. Me and my girlfriend flew in to Phoenix from New Jersey and we were starving. We came across this little corner place and it was the most inviting and memorable experience so far on our trip. This set the bar so high that we are now afraid everything else will seem insignificant in comparison. It is a little "mom and pop" shop - the owners were amazing. Extremely helpful and even gave us tips for our trip in Arizona. The food was superb. They even have coffee flavored beer! I would totally recommend this to anyone traveling through the area; and honestly - if I ever moved into the area, I'd make sure I was within a short distance of this gem, not just because the food was epic, but because the hospitality was genuine and on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Hob Nobs - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8QAR1iHknbtg_4RKpJqnxQ.text: We stopped here after church on Sunday before the Diamondback's game. The space is very quirky and inviting, the live music was such a great feature for lunch. I ordered the Grilled Salmon sandwich and have to say that it was AMAZING. However, we were waiting for our food for almost 40 minutes and we were late for the game. Other than the wait, this place was very yummy and I would recommend the food to anyone.

LA_UPjKqgtMinYC9VEA1wg.text: It was delicious. I loved it went and got lunch for myself and my coworkers. It was amazing although they messed up my order it was still delicious and very pleased. We got 2 of the The Carver sandwiches, Encanto Avocado Pizza Caesar salad and a side salad. It was amazing food and done well

ixuURP-bPnA47Hsido_Cag.text: The food that I finally received there was okay, but we had to eat so quickly we could not enjoy it. Myself and a friend went there for lunch and got there at around 11:20 am. We were there before most people would go there and believing we would beat the crowds. We went in and found that you could sit wherever you like but had to order up at the front. So we went up to order, I asked for the voodoo chicken salad which is one of their Specialties, and was informed they don't have that. Then I looked over the menu while my friend ordered, asked if they were out of chicken and was told no, wasn't real thrilled with what I saw, but I finally thought I'll try the Plantation chicken salad. They were out of that one too. Again, we were there before any crowds had hit. Finally, I ordered the Greek salad, with chicken. Then I sat down and waited for the food. My friend also ordered a salad, the cobb salad. We waited for over 45 minutes to receive our food. I had gone up once and asked where were the food was as we were on a lunch hour and needed to be able to have time to eat. They said they had catering and other phone orders that came in, so they were really backed up. If you are getting that much business from outside, why don't you lock the doors and keep people from coming in? Why would you not tell the people it's going to be a little while for their food? We were not told this when we came in. When we finally got our food, as I said above, we had to Wolf it down. What a very unpleasant experience, I still have to call them as they didn't even put the chicken on my salad, and they charge me for it. With the way we were treated there and with the way that was run, I will not go there again nor will I recommend this to anybody.

tdmGlPtwOnDxPdmK-GRWhA.text: A wonderful find! They had local beer selections and a wine&beer list that wasn't bad at all. I had the salmon sandwich and loved it at first bite!! More sauce would've been perfect but I didn't ask for more. I would totally order the sandwich again but ask for the fish to not be as cooked as it was; a few more minutes of heat and it would've been chewy. This is a perfect spot to study, write, read, and relax over some good food and tasty beer. Check it out!

3nwV1vmKLLC--6NveqJZfg.text: Normally I love this place the veggie mon sandwich is amazing and their coffees are great. But lately their service is terrible. I waited at the counter 10 minutes while they took orders from their friends and basically caught up on each others life stories. Another person came out from the back and just joined them in the discussion while others kept waiting to even put in their orders.  This is the second time this has happened to me there and I don't think will be a third.

i00_9rYJ5nC0aQLQIzZYkA.text: I have been here several times but today CUSTOMER SERVICE WASNT THE BEST..i have no idea why but the female attendee on monday june 22nd at the register was not nice ..very flat affect and i felt as if I was a bother for her...maybe it was a bad day but i will try a different place

jk8tQUNc086CRMV53bDX-w.text: Try a sandwich on a bagel.  Delicious.  Also the coffees and teas are made well.  Mostly it is a pleasant space to look around and just hang out at.  Bring a deck of cards or backgammon and just chill.

WT2Oy7a1AW4evqM82B9qrw.text: Charming local spot with live music and fantastic brownies! Cat is friendly customer service and my husband loves the cookies.

85PEu2-qbEZ_INfRskGnBw.text: Great place to go for a cup of coffee or beer but takes forever.  If there's a line when I walk in, I turn around and go somewhere else.  It's nice that they can fill growlers of beer to go.

pS_4-b-0qdpYAHLT0eAZ_Q.text: Amazing Lunch!!   Would highly recommend this place.  The Docs Choice Sandwich was awesome.   Homemade pretzel bun with turkey and house made chipotle aioli was incredible.   I'm definitely coming back!

P8zUoi3yuMLt1YQl9VyYmw.text: I'm not one for coffee houses,but Hob Nobs isn't just about the coffee. Their food is great as is the staff and comfort factor here. If you like salads,I recommend the Hob Nob Cobb. Their desserts are tasty and plentiful.

1JIBN5NWACtHsvPATcN74w.text: The tea is good but the food was kind of bland. It had all the right ideas but it didn't translate on the plate.

LdhCeCjUv_yoJJCEPVzxXQ.text: With the mystery user Paul having deleted his "review" ... and with a return visit I'm adding a star to my previous review.  The coffee is still nothing to crow about (try Conspire for the best coffee in town IMHO) but my sandwich was pretty good (but over priced).   I just SOOOO want to love this place it almost hurts.  Well the interior is stunningly beautiful and it's much improved from what was in the venue before (the dirty hippy coffee shop).

4Mjx-U6O0YK3IHg5vB5HbQ.text: Their coffee was...JUST RIGHT! What one exactly needs in the early morning for sure!  Their bagels...oh yum! We tried the "everything salmon" and "Jalapeno and cheese" bagels.

DPjXEOmhWKSTAQwWRCAK_g.text: LOVE. THIS. PLACE! I can't say enough great things about this place! Expect parking does stink and I feel bad for the owners because they are well aware of the parking issue! Don't park across the street in the vacant lot, unless you want to be towed, not from Hob Nobs but his annoying neighbor! Now on to the food! I think the sandwiches are top notch here! Doc's Choice is ONE of my favorites! This sandwich is full of mouth watering bits!! Every bite you take is worth the 8.95 you pay for it! And it is served on a Preztel Roll that will knock your socks off! Another favorite is The Smokey Joe, all of their aioli's they make really make all of their sandwiches pop here! Not only are lunches great but the bakery items are amazing as well! All the cookies cakes and muffins are delish!! The staff is a very friendly family always nice and willing to help you out from odering to free refills! Give them a try! Really nice Mom and Pop place with excellent food! Very cute and comfortable! I love coming in around Halloween as the owners go all out and decorate it!!

xlRrGBohooX4eBnex4aH-A.text: From what I remember (it has been a few months), the food was OK, and the ambience was quite lovely. It's a converted historic home, so it definitely has a lot of charm. There is handmade art on the walls (some much better than others). It does have an odd layout with many different room/levels, which again is a part of the aforementioned charm.  The food/drinks did not blow me away, so I have not been back there since, but I would be willing to give this place another shot, especially since they just put up a new shade-providing gazebo on the patio, something they desperately needed. Once the weather cools down I start loving quirky little places like this again :)

MohOzn9-vz68yYqLt0pTvg.text: Having never visited Hob Nob's previous incarnation -- The Willow House -- I cannot compare the two. However, from what I've experienced in comparison to what others have written about The Willow House, Hob Nobs is da' bomb. (Okay, I know what I just wrote is really cheesy, but I just had to -- I can't pass up an opportunity to flex my rhyming muscles!)   The place, for some reason, reminds me of the coffeehouse from Frasier. I think it is the dark wood, craftsman style bungalow feel. Very reminiscent of the Pacific Northwest, especially Seattle. I really like that warm and cozy vibe, and Hob Nobs pretty much has that covered. They kept the look and feel of the place like an actual home. There is a living room area with a more formal feel, a nice sitting area with leather couches and chairs around a fireplace, and then some nooks and crannies in the back for those wanting a more intimate and secluded setting.  As far as the coffee, I'm not much of a connoisseur of the stuff, but it was okay.  Nothing really special -- I have had better -- but it was decent. They've got other stuff too -- pastries, sandwiches and yummy chocolates from a company called Belle Fleur Chocolate.   The other nice touch is their live music offerings. A friend played there the other night, and despite the sound being a little so, so (not sure if it was his amp or theirs) it was a lovely setting for hearing some local and visiting musicians perform their stuff. I'm always on the lookout for cool places to hear up-and-coming singer/songwriters, and this is one more place I can put on my list, as well as enjoy a cool, cozy and creative atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Hob Nobs - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dave Yaden performing at Hob Nobs

2Tjz8sUoAuoDT00aYLQbWw.text: First time being here. Loved the atmosphere  and the muscles that works behind the coffee machine is dreamy

659PZwDBFwfAG50GawcRdg.text: Great food! A great atmosphere and the music and people vary in the best of ways. Unfortunately the manager/owner treats the employees poorly,

OQyueXIp6yosNGs0113HkA.text: The brownies are the bomb :) will come back enjoyed the experience  Sunday band is cool small cozy great food all home made that's hard to find

GAl8cjmfHwXdKw9eZlDqIg.text: Super friendly staff in a super cozy environment that makes you want to stay and hang out!  The barista made me a special watermelon mango Italian soda and it was to die for!  I enjoyed it with a greek pizza and was completely happy with my decision and the entire meal.  We ate outside on the patio with our dog and everyone enjoyed the evening.  I will definitely be back!

xtwvsVJGDX1Om4usuTHw7g.text: Food is super good. Sandwiches and pizza are my favorites. Service is friendly.Couldn't give it a 5 because of spotty wifi and limited parking. There's been times when I've wanted to come and just driven off to another place because of lack of parking. Overall great food and good coffee if you're not a coffee snob!

_a8TBco6jud3A_Ri0E-3Jg.text: Had the most wonderful time here for coffee and lunch.   Super warm and friendly staff.... they make you feel like you have known them for years.  Very homey environment with lots of gallery caliber art work to browse.  While the pizzas looked and smelled delicious.... I had the caprese salad which was super fresh and almost too pretty to eat.  Will be back!

xwyPPRPvQzlbqNY-jLP8QQ.text: Recently, our medical department was treated to the tastiest pizza EVER from Hob Nobs!  Warm, chewy, cheesy, fresh and filling can only describe this delicious pizza.  After checking out their online menu, I'm really looking forward to trying one their sandwiches and salads next.  Yum, yum and Yummmy!

1AUoTTR963NzTMxyP3914A.text: This is my favorite cafe in all of Phoenix! Their sandwiches are super yummy as is their quesadilla! The quesadilla has tomato in it and is served in a whole wheat tortilla so yummy. I also love their chai! It is from a concentrate instead of from syrup and I can really taste the full flavor and spice. I also find them to often have a quiet space to work during the day. Lastly the central Phoenix writing group is there on Wednesday nights which is fun to go to if you write.

BSPYLAKj_r21jxcr5TY_Eg.text: What a major disappointment. In April, my best friend came for a visit for the 1st time since I moved here to Phoenix 5 yrs ago.  I couldn't wait to bring her here as my previous experiences were stellar and atmosphere so quaint and fun. What a fiasco. On the evening of April 23rd were decided to drop in for a beverage and dessert.  Parking was horrible and included a car taking to two spots. When we finally found parking, we went inside to a somewhat busy crowd, maybe 20 people.  We were never greeted.  Not one employee even acknowledged our existence.  We stood around for a bit and then sat, waiting for someone to offer assistance.  About 10 people came in after us, all being greeted and told someone would be right with them.  Orders were taken and served and there we sat, waiting. We left.  No beverages or dessert.  Will never be back.

PozIG6IZIKgcvMm6NTFBXg.text: Great sandwiches, pizza, coffee and dessert (fresh slices of cake as big as your head)! It always gives you a True feeling of community every time you're there. Even though the people have always been nice, we've found them to be consistently disorganized or going through one complication or another. The quality of the food makes up for it if you're patient.

photos.caption: Photo of Hob Nobs - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gigantic chocolate cake!

I2oWVqQUzaKa3rYZJV0A3w.text: Saturday noon. Live music is nice but when it is so loud that your wait staff can't hear and get orders wrong it becomes problem.

ar_YLseY6F2kR1gUz07IGw.text: What a great find!   Stop in and support the local business owners.  Loving and warm hospitality.  But I know.  You came for the food.  Several choices of flat breads.  We had the Encanto avocado pizza.  Light crispy crust.  Fresh ingredients.  Drizzle of strawberry balsamic reduction.  Very nice.  We had bruschetta as the appetizer.  Different twist on it. I appreciate that.   For dessert we had a fresh baked red velvet and cheesecake muffin.  Oh my.  Really enjoyed the lay out as well.  Nice sized outdoor area as well as 4 or 5 compartment areas.  So you can always feel like you're having an intimate luncheon if you like.  Very generous to military as well!   Oh.  And we picked up some cute little Christmas gifts.  Chocolate tamale

photos.caption: Photo of Hob Nobs - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1DkGXLYaTYL7ulWf47uTGg.text: Excellent quesadilla! During Happy Hour (3 to 7pm) appetizers are $2 off so the quesadilla ended up being $5. It was really delicious! 5/5  I also had a slice of the chocolate cake but it fell short. 3/5 I bake a lot so maybe I'm more particular about baked goods than the average person. I asked if it was in-house and they said no, it's from a local company.  They said that the cookies, brownies, and other items (basically everything except the cakes in their display) are made in-house. I will have to try the goods that they actually make there, next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Hob Nobs - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Their Avocado Encanto pizza, was delicious!
Photo of Hob Nobs - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Slice of coconut cake and their delicious quesadilla.
Photo of Hob Nobs - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Chocolate Cake slice, $6.

ReGmZ8cIroeJlclmRzVFEg.text: CHARMING!  This is a very cute little cottage with delicious food.  When u walk in u feel like u are entering the home of the seven dwarves, so cute.  Then one of the first things u see is a glass case with gigantic beautiful pastries.  Keep going and u will see a bar with a very detailed display of all the beers and IPAs they have to offer.  I chose to sit at the bar always assuming I will get quicker and better service with some "in yo face".  I was greeted by a sweet and eccentric lady who was happy to talk about all of their daily specials and what is brought in locally.  She had her coffee cup and was just chillin out, thankful that she wasn't stuck out in the cold rainy day.  I decided for the Thursday sandwich choice - Docs.  It was served on a toasty pretzel bun and had some peppers and creamy delish sauce paired with a beautiful green salad with tomatoes and cucumbers.  I could see the chefs in the kitchen preparing my order and I was impressed with the time and care they put into each little detail.   This is not the place u want to go when u are in a rush or need to get back to work in a jif.  It seems like they are on their own mellow clock but that's cool if u have the time to spare.  It was comfy and yummy.

Photo of Hob Nobs - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hmmm.....wanna chill by the fire?

Totally worth it

vPBkFebdus2c_YQp_HdzrA.text: It can be pricey but I love this place. I like the White Chocolate Mocha, oatmeal cookies, and sandwiches plus the chocolate cake is to die for!

Ct7j7Rs-Cl-qmgXrasCdaw.text: We were there today, blended coffee was powdery & no flavor at all. Sandwich was Not good, bread was stale.  Service was awful. My friend will not go back

_ViI3ROZd-IrwwetY4a-Dg.text: Very nice place with very good food and friendly staff. A must visit when in the downtown area.

suNl5ko80zGjAJh2x95Ydg.text: Friendly service. Bar area has wide variety of spirits, wine, and beer. Their signature bottle of red wine is good, with a cute Day of the Dead themed bottle decor. Delicious chai tea.   I've had several things off of the menu and it's been hit (mostly) or miss--pita bread and quesadilla is very bland. I particularly like the bruschetta (have ordered a few times), salmon sandwich, and the chicken pesto sandwich. Haven't tried the pizza yet, but heard it's good. The caprese skewers were a bit disappointing for $7-super small serving. I like this place for its unique and quirky atmosphere, and friendly atmosphere.
